a group of people or companies who join together in order to achieve a particular aim
to arrange for written work, photographs etc to be sold to a number of different newspapers, magazines etc
His column is syndicated throughout America.
a group of people or companies that work together to achieve a particular aim
a bankingsyndicate led by the Hong Kong Bank of Australia
The publishing group has bought a 45% stake, joining the companyâ€™s shareholder syndicate.
if a company, especially a bank or insurance company, syndicates a loan, debt etc, it provides the loan, debt etc with a group of other companies
Some of the largest loans were syndicated to smaller creditors.
to arrange for articles, photographs, or radio or television programmes to be sold to several newspapers, television stations etc
The broadcasting station asked him to put together a talk show that could be syndicated nationally.
